snippet: Natural gas started flowing from the Tamar reservoir, which is expected to supply 50 to 80 percent of Israel’s natural gas needs over the next 10 years.
abstract: Israel moves closer to its goal of energy independence, as natural gas starts flowing from Tamar reservoir in Mediterranean Sea, which is expected to supply 50 to 80 percent of country's natural gas needs over the next 10 years.
lead_paragraph: Natural gas started flowing from the Tamar reservoir, which is expected to supply 50 to 80 percent of Israel’s natural gas needs over the next 10 years.

headline.seo: Israel Turns On Natural Gas Flow at Offshore Site
headline.main: Israel Taps an Offshore Natural Gas Field
headline.print_headline: Israel Taps an Offshore Natural Gas Field
